title.bibl: Lietuva, Oct. 29, 1909. Ausra Society to Give Four Lectures

div.bibl: Lietuva, Oct. 29, 1909. AUSRA SOCIETY TO GIVE FOUR LECTURES

body.p: The AUSRA (Aurora) Society, which is a student aid and general educational society, decided at a meeting, held on October 24, to give four lectures, beginning on November 14. All the lectures will be held at the hall of the Lithuanian Community Center, 3149 South Halsted Street. The first lecture will be free to the Lithuanian public.
At the meeting, Dr. A. L. Graiciunas has been authorized to collect funds for the purchase of a stereoscope, making it possible for the Society to give illustrated lectures.
They plan to purchase a stereoscope from Mr. Radziukas for fifty dollars. A decision was also made at the meeting to hold lectures in Lithuanian colonies located outside the city limits of Chicago.
The following lectures will be given by the Society at the Lithuanian Community Center:
"The Value of Knowledge," by John Ilgaudas, on Sunday afternoon, November 14.
"Ancient Music of Various Nations," by Mikas Petrauskas, on Sunday afternoon, November 28.
"Is it Necessary For Every Sick Person to Take Medicine?" by Dr. Anthony Rutkauskas, on Sunday afternoon, December 12.
"History of nnnn Music," by Mikas Petrauskas, on Sunday afternoon, December 26.
